acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists
acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.rationale: Category 1 because of "SPECIES: Rat; ENDPOINT: LC50; VALUE: 0.0031 mg/L "(RTECS (2005)

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Category 4 based on SPECIES: Rat;  ENDPOINT: LD50;VALUE:1140 mg/kg;  (PATTY (2001)

carcinogenicity.rationale: It was set as Category 1A based on the category of IARC: 1(1993). However, "as cadmium and its compound."

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: May cause long lasting harmful effects to aquatic life
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Classified into Category 4, since it is a metal, behavior in water is unknown.

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Test methods applicable to solid substances are not available.

explosives.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive properties present in the molecules.

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases

flammable_solids.rationale: Although dust and granular cadmium are known to be combustible (cause dust explosion) (ICSC (J) (1993)), there is no data about other states. So it cannot be classified.

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: The substance was classified as Category 2 by the technical guidelines. About half of the results of chromosome aberration tests using somatic cells from people who had epidemiological/occupational exposure are positive (IARC 58 (1993)). And based on EU-Annex1: Muta. Cat. 3 and the note in IARC 58 (1993): "the working group for carcinogenicity evaluation took into account the evidence that ionic cadmium shows genetic toxicity in various eukaryotic cells, including human cells."

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Inorganic compounds containing no oxygen and halogen.

reproductive_toxicity.hazard_statement: Suspected of damaging fertility or the unborn child
reproductive_toxicity.rationale:
There is no description about the general toxicity to parent animals. 
However, decreases in the number of litter, foetal death, the growth inhibition and malformation of reduction of fetus were observed, and inhibitions of growth and motor activity development in newborn were also observed (IARC 58 (1993) and EHC 134 (1992)). 
Therefore, according to the technical guide, it was classified into Category 2. 
In addition, there are existing classifications, such as EU-Annex 1:Repr.Cat.3;R62-63.

self_reactive_substances.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive or self-reactive properties present in the molecule.

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Not cause a serious reaction with water. (Hazardous Substance DB, 2nd, 1993; ICSC(J), 1993)

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.classification: Category 1 (kidney, lung, blood, bone, respiratory system)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: Cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (kidney, lung, blood, bone, respiratory system)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Chronic pneumonia, emphysema, proteinuria, etc. are observed in animal experiments (PATTY (5th, 2001)). "Long duration occupational exposure produces the serious chronic effects which is mainly concerned with lungs and kidney to humans. Moreover, the symptoms of osteoporosis or osteomalacia are affected. " (EHC(J) 134 (1997)), "Chronic exposures brings humans anemia, eosinophilia, rhinits, emphysema, and tooth decolorization, and renal disease". (ACGIH (7th, 2001)) "The primary target organ of chronic disorders is the kidney". (PATTY (5th, 2001)) They were classified into Category 1 (renal, lungs, blood, bones, respiratory systems) based on these descriptions.

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement: Causes damage to organs (lung, respiratory system)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: The substance was classified as Category 1 (lung, respiratory organs). Based on the reports, such as "when humans are exposed to the fumes generated by heating, they may develop bronchitis, pneumonia, pulmonary edema, etc, and die in some cases" (ACGIH (2001)), and it "causes fatal pulmonary edema in animals after exposure by inhalation in high concentrations"  (EHC (J) 134 (1997)).
